definitions.definition: a person who takes part in terrorism

examples.text: The terrorists are threatening to blow up the plane.
The bomb attacks have been attributed to a group of international terrorists.
the recruitment of young would-be terrorists
the victim of a terrorist atrocity
Three suspected terrorists have been arrested.
A terrorist bomb brought down a huge section of the central bank building.

wordOrigin: late 18th cent.: from French terroriste, from Latin terror, from terrere ‘frighten’. The word was originally applied to supporters of the Jacobins in the French Revolution, who advocated repression and violence in pursuit of the principles of democracy and equality.
